info.title: Massive Core API v2
info.description: Massive Core API v2 is the API to manage Massive categories data.

tags.name: Categories
tags.description: Subset of the API dealing with categories, i.e., the top-level partitioning of the data. Examples of categories are Televisions, Computers, Mobile Phones, New-Jersey Sports & Entertainment Venues, Cigars, Helmets, Face Cleansers, etc.

tags.name: Brands
tags.description: Subset of the API dealing with Brands

tags.name: Product Categories
tags.description: Subset of the API dealing with Product Categories, i.e., the second-level partitioning of data inside a category. Example of possible Product Categories inside the Televisions category are Led TVs, OLED TVs, LCD TVs, Plasma TVs, etc.

tags.name: Features
tags.description: Subset of the API dealing with Features (a.k.a. topics)

tags.name: Commons
tags.description: Subset of the API dealing with the common elements for each category. Example are Websites, Items, Items Aggregators Items Tags, Reviews etc.

get.summary: List all available items for this category
get.description: List the items available in this category

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 0-based index of the starting item for pagination, if not specified 0 will be used

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: page size, if not specified 10 will be used (maximum 100)

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description:
Sort field (default REVIEW_DATE):
 * `ITEM_NAME` - The name of the item
 * `BUCKET_NAME` - The name of the bucket related to the item
 * `NUMBER_OF_REVIEWS` - The number of reviews of the item
 * `BRAND_NAME` - The name of the brand to the item
 * `WEBSITE_NAME` - The name of the website related to the item
 * `CREATION_DATE` - The creation date the item on the database

get.summary: Count the items respecting the filters values
get.description: the number of items matching crieria

get.summary: Return a single item
get.description: Return the specified item

requestBody.description: The bucket fields to be updated.

get.description: List all the categories of an item

get.summary: List all the subcategories
get.description: List all the available subcategories. Subcategories are used-defined fields that can be associated withto items_buckets

requestBody.description: The subcategory to be added. Adding always happens at the last position

parameters.name: subcategoryId
parameters.description: Identifier of the subcategory to modify

delete.description: Delete the specified subcategory. When deleting a subcategory all values associated with this subcategories are deleted. Moreover, all assignments of such values to itemsBuckets are lost too. So, user should be warned before performing such action. It might be useful to show the number of values (/vaues/count) and assignments (/assignments) that will be deleted.

parameters.name: subcategoryId
parameters.description: Identifier of the subcategory to delete

get.summary: List all the subcategories types
get.description:
List all the available subcategories types. Subcategories types are used-defined fields that describe 
the value datatype (numeric, date,  string etc) of the subcategories values

post.description: Change the order of subcategories by inserting the specified subcategory at the given position.

requestBody.description: The subcategory to move and the position where to inser it

get.summary: List all the values for a specific subcategory
get.description: List all the available subcategories. Subcategories are used-defined fields that can be associated withto items_buckets

post.description: Adds a new subcategory value if not exists

requestBody.description: The subcategory to be added. Adding always happens at the last position

delete.description: deletes the subcategory value with the given id

parameters.name: subcategoryId

parameters.name: valueId

get.summary: List all available item buckets
get.description: List the buckets available in this category

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: 0-based index of the starting item for pagination, if not specified 0 will be used

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: page size, if not specified 10 will be used (maximum 100)

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description:
Specifies by which filed to sort the results. If not specified the default is BUCKET_NAME; possible values are:
 * `BUCKET_NAME` - The name of the bucket
 * `NUMBER_OF_ITEMS` - The total number of items related to the bucket
 * `NUMBER_OF_REVIEWS` - The total number of reviews related to the bucket
 * `SUBCATEGORY_<<ID>>` - Sort by the value of the subcategory identified by id <<ID>>, e.g.: 
 * `SUBCATEGORY_13` - Sort by the value of the subcategory with identifier 13. 
 * `SUBCATEGORY_17` - Sort by the value of the subcategory with identifier 17. 
 * `SUBCATEGORY_18` - Sort by the value of the subcategory with identifier 18.

206.description: The bucket was correctly created, but some errors were found while updating the subcategories values

get.summary: Returns the list of words clusters sets
get.description: Returns the list of available wordsClustersSets. A wordsClustersSet is a clustering, i.e., a set of clusters and, for each cluster, a set of keywords

200.description: returns the list of WordsClustersSet, or WordsClustersSetFormatArray if the record_format query parameter equals RECORD_FORMAT_ARRAY

parameters.name: offset

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: page size, if not specified 10 will be used (maximum 100)

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description:
Sort field (default REVIEW_DATE):
 * `PRODUCT_NAME` - The name of the product
 * `REVIEW_TITLE` - The title of the review
 * `REVIEW_RATING` - The review rating
 * `REVIEW_DATE` - The review date
 * `WEBSITE_NAME` - The name of the website (source)

get.description: Returns the count of reviews referring the given word.

post.summary: Modifies the hidden or bucketId properties of specified items
post.description: Modifies the hidden or bucketId properties of specified items

requestBody.description: The list of items to modify and the values of the properties to change

404.description: the specified WordsCluster was not found

SubcategoryItemType.description: Specifies the type of the subcategory

subcategoryName.description: the name of the subcategory. Since this name correspond to colum names when exporting (e.g., for Tableau), some constraint mght be applied on the accepted characters

subcategoryDescription.example: The operating system installed on the mobile phones

subcategoryPlaceHolder.description: a message explaining the user which type of value to insert
subcategoryPlaceHolder.example: Insert the Operting System (e.g., Android, Windows, Symbian)

subcategoryIndex.description: an index to sort subcategories. The absolute value is not important, only relative value is important to define an ordering among subcategories. There cannot exist two subcategories with the same subcategoryIndex

hidden.description: whether the corresponding column is visible or not

subcategoryIndex.description: an index to sort subcategories. The absolute value is not important, only relative value is important to define an ordering among subcategories. There cannot exist two subcategories with the same subcategoryIndex

subcategoryValueIndex.description: an index to sort subcategories. The absolute value is not important, only relative value is important to define an ordering among subcategories. There cannot exist two subcategories with the same subcategoryIndex

subcategoryTypeDescription.example: year types of data in the format yyyy-MM-dd

numericRangeMax.description: maximum allowed value that defines the upper limit of the range for this numeric type

numericRangeMin.description: minimum allowed value that defines the bottom limit of the range for this numeric type

maxLength.description: maximun number of characthers allowed for the subcateogry values of this type

bucketName.description: the name of the items bucket. Bucket names are unique in the category.

bucketName_english.description: the name of the items bucket.

bucketNotes.description: some notes assigned to the bucket.

processed.description: true if the this bucket has been completed false otheriwse

hidden.description: true if the bucket should appear in the backend false otherwise

subcategoryValueId.description: if specified, it will be used to assign the subcategory value, if 'null', the subcategoryValue should be specified

subcategoryValue.description: in case the subcateogry id is not specified this value will be used. If different from 'null', the specified value must be compatible with the type of category (e.g., if this subcategory has type NUMERIC, this value should be for example 10)

ItemsBucketsChangeRequest.description: the properties of the BucketsItem that can be changed by the user and the list of BucketsItems to change. Only the specified properties will be changed

hidden.description: specifies whether the item bucket is visible or not (muted/unmuted)

processed.description: specifies whether the item bucket has been processed or not

bucketItemIds.description: list of the identifiers of the BucketsItems to change

ItemsBucketsDeleteRequest.description: list of the identifiers of the BucketsItems to delete

SubcategoryItemValueNew.description: the subset of the SubcategoryValueItem fields that must be specified when adding a new one

SubcategoryItemValueUpdate.description: the subset of the SubcategoryValueItem fields that must be specified when adding a new one

subcategoryValue.description: an update name for the subcategory value.

subcategoryValueIndex.description: the updated index for the subcategoryValue.

SubcategoryItemNew.description: the subset of the SubcategoryItem fields that must be specified when adding a new one

subcategoryName.description: the name of the subcategory. Since this name correspond to colum names when exporting (e.g., for Tableau), some constraint mght be applied on the accepted characters

subcategoryDescription.example: The operating system installed on the mobile phones

subcategoryPlaceHolder.description: a message explaining the user which type of value to insert
subcategoryPlaceHolder.example: Insert the Operting System (e.g., Android, Windows, Symbian)

hidden.description: whether the corresponding column is visible or not (default: false)
specifies whether the item is visible or not (muted/unmuted)

ItemValueChange.description: the properties of the item that can be changed by the user. At least on between bucketId and hidden should be specified

bucketId.description: identifier of the bucket this item belongs to

hidden.description: specifies whether the item is visible or not (muted/unmuted)

ItemsChangeRequest.description: the properties of the item that can be changed by the user and the list of items to change. Only the specified properties will be changed. At least on between bucketId and hidden should be specified

bucketId.description: identifier of the bucket this item belongs to

hidden.description: specifies whether the item is visible or not (muted/unmuted)

itemIds.description: list of the items to change

bucketName.description: the name of the items bucket. Bucket names are unique in the category.

bucketName_english.description: the name of the items bucket.

processed.description: true if the this bucket has been completed false otheriwse

hidden.description: true if the bucket should appear in the backend false otherwise

CategoryStatus.description:
a value specifying whether the variations assigned to this category should be
included or excluded from the category:
  
value | definition
------|-----------
 -1   | productCategory to be excluded
  0   | unimportant productCategory
  1   | productCategory to be included

wordsClustersSetId.description: a unique identifier for this clusters set

label.description: the label shown to the user to identify this clusters set

description.description: a description of the clusters set. Might contain info about the algorithm used to generate this clusters set, or about the parameters of the algorithm

completed.description: true when the clusters set is published (all clusters have been edited), false if the editing is still in progress

WordsClustersSetChanges.description: the fields of the words clusters set that can be updated by a PUT operation. No field is mandatory, but at least one should be specified

label.description: the label shown to the user to identify this clusters set

description.description: a description of the clusters set. Might contain info about the algorithm used to generate this clusters set, or about the parameters of the algorithm

completed.description: true when the clusters set is published (all clusters have been edited), false if the editing is still in progress

WordsClustersSetFormatArray.description:
a compact version of WordsClustersSet, suited to minimized bandwidth usage. The fields
in the array are ordered as it follows:

index | field              
------|--------------------
  0   | wordsClustersSetId 
  1   | label              
  2   | description            
  3   | completed

WordsCluster.description: a words cluster (aka TOPIC or FEATURE) is a set of keywords

wordsClusterId.description: a unique identifier for this cluster

label.description: the visible name of this words cluster

label_english.description: in the case that the label field is not english, this field may contain the English translation of label. Not used if label is already in English

minSimilarity.description: The upeer thershold to the similarity value for this topic. keywords with a validi similarity below this value will be hidden

description.description: A user-defined comment/description of the topic, aimed to be exported to the customer

notes.description: A user-defined note about the topic, not exported to the customer.

processed.description: true if the clusters has been already edited (identified), false otherwise (todo)

WordsClusterFormatArray.description:
same as WordsCluster, but in a more compact format to save bandwidth:

index | field              
------|--------------------
  0   | wordsClusterId 
  1   | label              
  2   | minSimilarity            
  3   | description              
  4   | notes             
  5   | processed

WordsClusterChanges.description: the field of a WordsCluster (aka TOPIC or FEATURE) passed to the server in a PUT or POST operation. No field is mandatory, but at least one should be provided

label.description: the visible name of this words cluster

label_english.description: the English translation of label, if label is not in English

minSimilarity.description: The upper thershold to the similarity value for this topic. keywords with a valid similarity below this value will be hidden

description.description: A user-defined comment/description of the topic, aimed to be exported to the customer

notes.description: A user-defined note about the topic, not exported to the customer.

processed.description: true if the clusters has been already edited (identified), false otherwise (todo)

WordVectorReview.description: a WordVectorReview object merges together info about a wordVector (i.e., a keyword), a review, and the occurences of the WordVector inside the review

productName.description: the name of the item related to the review

reviewRating.description: the rating of the review, usually expressed in stars, ranging from 1 to 5. Reviews with a different range are scaled to the range 1, 5

reviewDate.description: the date of the review in the format YYYY-MM-DD

reviewText.example: Sound quality is the best I've heard on a speaker of this size!

websiteId.description: identifier of the website (Source) from which the review originates

websiteName.description: name of the website (Source) from which the review originates

websiteURL.description: name of the website (Source) from which the review originates

beginPosition.description: the 0-based starting position, in number of characters, of this sentence inside the full review text

endPosition.description: the 0-based ending position, in number of characters, of this sentence inside the full review text

word.description: the values of this word. Note that this value could be slightly different from the one appearing in the text, as word is usually normalized (i.e., lowercase, singular for nouns, infinite form for verbs, etc), wheras the review text is not

beginPosition.description: the 0-based starting position, in number of characters, of this word inside the full review text

endPosition.description: the 0-based ending position, in number of characters, of this word inside the full review text

WordVectorMoveRequest.description: a WordVectoreMoveRequest is the request to move e list of WordVectors to another WordsCluster

destinationWordsClusterId.description: the identifier of the destination WordsCluster

WordsClustersMergeRequest.description: a WordsClustersMergeRequest is the request to merge a list of WordsClusters into another one

WordVectorDeleteRequest.description: a WordVectorDeleteRequest is the request to move a list of WordVectors to the trash

WordVector.description: a WordVector is a keyword with some additional info such as statistics and vectorspace-ralated info

wordsClusterId.description: a unique identifier the owning cluster

similarity.description: The distance between center and each point. Similarity may be null when a word is assigned to a WordsCluster different from the original one. This is due to the cat that centrality is computed as distance from the WordsCluster barycenter; when the word is assigned to a different cluster distance from the original barycenter does not make any sense

centrality.description: How important is the word in the contexts were it is used

numReviews.description: number of reviews containing this word

numOpinions.description: number of opinions containing this word

numFiveStarsReviews.description: number of five-stars reviews containing this word

numFourStarsReviews.description: number of four-stars reviews containing this word

numThreeStarsReviews.description: number of three-stars reviews containing this word

numTwoStarsReviews.description: number of two-stars reviews containing this word

numOneStarReviews.description: number of one-star reviews containing this word

numPositiveOpinions.description: number of positive opinions containing this word

numNegativeOpinions.description: number of positive opinions containing this word

numNeutralOpinions.description: number of positive opinions containing this word

numNullOpinions.description: number of positive opinions containing this word

locked.description: locked words are always visible inside a cluster, independently of the setting of the similarity cut. This might happen, for instance, when a word is moved to a different cluster with respect to the original one, and its similarit is not valid anymore

WordVectorFormatArray.description:
same as WordVector, but in a more compact format to save bandwidth:

index | field              
------|--------------------
  0   | wordsClusterId 
  1   | wordVectorId 
  2   | word 
  3   | similarity 
  4   | centrality 
  5   | numReviews 
  6   | numOpinions 
  7   | numFiveStarsReviews 
  8   | numFourStarsReviews 
  9   | numThreeStarsReviews 
 10   | numTwoStarsReviews 
 11   | numOneStarReviews 
 12   | numPositiveOpinions 
 13   | numNegativeOpinions 
 14   | numNeutralOpinions 
 15   | numNullOpinions 
 16   | locked

RecordFormat.description: Specifies whether the response is an array of objects (default - when this parameter is not specified or its value is RECORD_FORMAT_RECORD), or an array of objects formatted as array (when this parameter equals RECORD_FORMAT_ARRAY)
